intro: Cincinalis dealbata, commonly known as the white-flowered cincinalis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its showy, white petals that bloom in clusters, often with a subtle pinkish hue. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, preferring well-drained soils and full sunlight. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Cincinalis dealbata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
